com.idevicesinc.sweetblue

Enum BleDeviceState

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<BleDeviceState>
      • com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.BleDeviceState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BitwiseEnum, Flag, State, UsesCustomNull, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<BleDeviceState>

    public enum BleDeviceState
extends java.lang.Enum<BleDeviceState>
implements State
    An enumeration of the various states that a BleDevice can be in. Note that a device can and usually will be in multiple states simultaneously. Use BleDevice.setListener_State(StateListener) to be notified of state changes.
    See Also:
    BleDevice.StateListener

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.utils.State

        State.ChangeEvent<T_State extends State>, State.ChangeIntent

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      ADVERTISING
      When BleDevice.getOrigin() is BleDeviceOrigin.FROM_DISCOVERY, a device will always be in this state while CONNECTED is not active.
      AUTHENTICATED
      This state becomes active either if the BleTransaction provided to BleDevice.connect(BleTransaction.Auth) or BleDevice.connect(BleTransaction.Auth, BleTransaction.Init) succeeds with BleTransaction.succeed(), OR if you use BleDevice.connect() or BleDevice.connect(BleTransaction.Init) - i.e.
      AUTHENTICATING
      This state can only become active if you use BleDevice.connect(BleTransaction.Auth) or BleDevice.connect(BleTransaction.Auth, BleTransaction.Init) to start a connection with an authentication transaction.
      BONDED
      Analogous to BluetoothDevice.BOND_BONDED.
      BONDING
      Analogous to BluetoothDevice.BOND_BONDING.
      CONNECTED
      Analogous to BluetoothProfile.STATE_CONNECTED.
      CONNECTING
      Analogous to BluetoothProfile.STATE_CONNECTING.
      CONNECTING_OVERALL
      A convenience flag for checking if the device is connecting in an overall sense.
      DISCONNECTED
      The device will always be in this state while CONNECTED is not active.
      DISCOVERED
      The device will always be in this state unless it becomes UNDISCOVERED.
      DISCOVERING_SERVICES
      This state is active while we request a list of services from the native stack after becoming CONNECTED.
      INITIALIZED
      This is generally the state you want to listen for to consider your BleDevice "fully" connected and ready to go, instead of basing it off of just CONNECTED.
      INITIALIZING
      This state can only become active if you use BleDevice.connect(BleTransaction.Init) or BleDevice.connect(BleTransaction.Auth, BleTransaction.Init) to start a connection with an initialization transaction.
      NULL
      Dummy value returned from any method that would otherwise return Java's built-in null.
      PERFORMING_OTA
      This state for "over-the-air" updates becomes active when you call BleDevice.performOta(BleTransaction.Ota) and remains active until the provided BleTransaction calls BleTransaction.succeed() or BleTransaction.fail() (or of course if your BleDevice becomes DISCONNECTED).
      RECONNECTING_LONG_TERM
      If BleNodeConfig.reconnectFilter is set appropriately and the device implicitly disconnects, either through going out of range, signal disruption, or whatever, then the device will enter this state.
      RECONNECTING_SHORT_TERM
      If BleNodeConfig.reconnectFilter is set appropriately and the device implicitly disconnects this state will be entered.
      RETRYING_BLE_CONNECTION
      This state indicates that a connect has failed, but SweetBlue will be retrying the connection again.
      SERVICES_DISCOVERED
      This state is active after DISCOVERING_SERVICES completes successfully.
      UNBONDED
      Analogous to BluetoothDevice.BOND_NONE.
      UNDISCOVERED
      The device has been undiscovered and you should have been notified through BleManager.DiscoveryListener.onEvent(DiscoveryEvent).

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int bit()
      Returns the bit (0x1, 0x2, 0x4, etc.) this enum represents based on the Flag.ordinal().
      boolean didEnter(int oldStateBits, int newStateBits)
      Given an old and new state mask, for example from BleDevice.StateListener.onEvent(com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.BleDevice.StateListener.StateEvent) or BleManager.StateListener.onEvent(com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.BleManager.StateListener.StateEvent), this method tells you whether the the 'this' state was appended.
      boolean didExit(int oldStateBits, int newStateBits)
      Reverse of State.didEnter(int, int).
      static BleDeviceState getTransitoryConnectionState(int stateMask)
      A convenience for UI purposes, this returns the "highest" connection state representing a transition from one state to another, so something with "ING" in the name (except PERFORMING_OTA).
      boolean isNull()
      Returns true if this state is meant to stand in for Java's built-in null.

      Does a bitwise OR for this state and the given state.
      int or(int bits)
      Does a bitwise OR for this state and the given bits.
      boolean overlaps(int mask)
      Convenience method for checking if (Flag.bit() & mask) != 0x0.

      Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name.
      static BleDeviceState[] values()
      Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared.
      static BleDeviceState[] VALUES()
      Returns same as values(), but for performance reasons this does not return a new array every time.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • NULL

        public static final BleDeviceState NULL
        Dummy value returned from any method that would otherwise return Java's built-in null. A normal BleDevice will never be in this state, but this will be the sole state of BleDevice.NULL.

      • UNDISCOVERED

        public static final BleDeviceState UNDISCOVERED
        The device has been undiscovered and you should have been notified through BleManager.DiscoveryListener.onEvent(DiscoveryEvent). This means the object is effectively dead. BleManager has removed all references to it and you should do the same.

      • RECONNECTING_LONG_TERM

        public static final BleDeviceState RECONNECTING_LONG_TERM
        If BleNodeConfig.reconnectFilter is set appropriately and the device implicitly disconnects, either through going out of range, signal disruption, or whatever, then the device will enter this state. It will continue in this state until you return BleNodeConfig.ReconnectFilter.Please.stopRetrying() from BleNodeConfig.ReconnectFilter.onEvent(BleNodeConfig.ReconnectFilter.ReconnectEvent) or call BleDevice.disconnect() or when the device actually successfully reconnects.
        See Also:
        RECONNECTING_SHORT_TERM

      • RECONNECTING_SHORT_TERM

        public static final BleDeviceState RECONNECTING_SHORT_TERM
        If BleNodeConfig.reconnectFilter is set appropriately and the device implicitly disconnects this state will be entered. Unlike with RECONNECTING_LONG_TERM, entering this state does not mean that the BleDevice becomes DISCONNECTED. By all outward appearances the library treats the BleDevice as still being CONNECTED while transparently trying to reconnect under the hood using BleNodeConfig.reconnectFilter. You can even perform BleDevice.read(UUID, BleDevice.ReadWriteListener), BleDevice.write(java.util.UUID, byte[]), etc. and they will be queued up until the device *actually* reconnects under the hood.
        See Also:
        RECONNECTING_LONG_TERM

      • RETRYING_BLE_CONNECTION

        public static final BleDeviceState RETRYING_BLE_CONNECTION
        This state indicates that a connect has failed, but SweetBlue will be retrying the connection again. This is useful for determining if you need to retry connecting app-side or not. In this case, the device will be DISCONNECTED, and look like it's not doing anything, unless it's also in this state. This is not to be confused with RECONNECTING_SHORT_TERM or RECONNECTING_LONG_TERM, which only go into those states once the BleDevice gets into the INITIALIZED state.

      • DISCOVERED

        public static final BleDeviceState DISCOVERED
        The device will always be in this state unless it becomes UNDISCOVERED.

      • ADVERTISING

        public static final BleDeviceState ADVERTISING
        When BleDevice.getOrigin() is BleDeviceOrigin.FROM_DISCOVERY, a device will always be in this state while CONNECTED is not active. Note that this doesn't *necessarily* mean that the actual physical device is advertising, just that it was BleManager.DiscoveryListener.LifeCycle.DISCOVERED or BleManager.DiscoveryListener.LifeCycle.REDISCOVERED through a BleManager.startScan(), so it is still assumed to be advertising.

      • DISCONNECTED

        public static final BleDeviceState DISCONNECTED
        The device will always be in this state while CONNECTED is not active. Analogous to BluetoothProfile.STATE_DISCONNECTED.

      • UNBONDED

        public static final BleDeviceState UNBONDED
        Analogous to BluetoothDevice.BOND_NONE. May not be relevant for your application if you don't use encrypted characteristics.

      • BONDING

        public static final BleDeviceState BONDING
        Analogous to BluetoothDevice.BOND_BONDING. May not be relevant for your application if you don't use encrypted characteristics. From this state, a device will either become BONDED (if successful) or UNBONDED. If the latter, use BleDevice.BondListener to get further information on what happened.

      • BONDED

        public static final BleDeviceState BONDED
        Analogous to BluetoothDevice.BOND_BONDED. May not be relevant for your application if you don't use encrypted characteristics.

      • CONNECTING_OVERALL

        public static final BleDeviceState CONNECTING_OVERALL
        A convenience flag for checking if the device is connecting in an overall sense. This state is active if any one of CONNECTING, DISCOVERING_SERVICES, AUTHENTICATING, or INITIALIZING is also active. It is suggested to have BONDING be a part of this also using BleDeviceConfig.bondFilter but technically BONDING can be done outside of this state.

      • CONNECTING

        public static final BleDeviceState CONNECTING
        Analogous to BluetoothProfile.STATE_CONNECTING. If this state is active then we're in the middle of establishing an actual BLE connection.

      • CONNECTED

        public static final BleDeviceState CONNECTED
        Analogous to BluetoothProfile.STATE_CONNECTED. Once this state becomes active we don't consider ourselves "fully" connected because we still generally have to discover services and maybe do a few reads or writes to initialize things. So generally speaking no significant action should be taken when the BleDevice becomes CONNECTED. Instead it's best to listen for INITIALIZED.

      • DISCOVERING_SERVICES

        public static final BleDeviceState DISCOVERING_SERVICES
        This state is active while we request a list of services from the native stack after becoming CONNECTED.

      • SERVICES_DISCOVERED

        public static final BleDeviceState SERVICES_DISCOVERED
        This state is active after DISCOVERING_SERVICES completes successfully.

      • AUTHENTICATING

        public static final BleDeviceState AUTHENTICATING
        This state can only become active if you use BleDevice.connect(BleTransaction.Auth) or BleDevice.connect(BleTransaction.Auth, BleTransaction.Init) to start a connection with an authentication transaction.

      • AUTHENTICATED

        public static final BleDeviceState AUTHENTICATED
        This state becomes active either if the BleTransaction provided to BleDevice.connect(BleTransaction.Auth) or BleDevice.connect(BleTransaction.Auth, BleTransaction.Init) succeeds with BleTransaction.succeed(), OR if you use BleDevice.connect() or BleDevice.connect(BleTransaction.Init) - i.e. you connect without authentication. In the latter case the AUTHENTICATING state is skipped and we go straight to being implicitly AUTHENTICATED.

      • INITIALIZING

        public static final BleDeviceState INITIALIZING
        This state can only become active if you use BleDevice.connect(BleTransaction.Init) or BleDevice.connect(BleTransaction.Auth, BleTransaction.Init) to start a connection with an initialization transaction.

      • INITIALIZED

        public static final BleDeviceState INITIALIZED
        This is generally the state you want to listen for to consider your BleDevice "fully" connected and ready to go, instead of basing it off of just CONNECTED.

        This state becomes active either if the BleTransaction provided to BleDevice.connect(BleTransaction.Init) or BleDevice.connect(BleTransaction.Auth, BleTransaction.Init) succeeds with BleTransaction.succeed(), OR if you use BleDevice.connect() or BleDevice.connect(BleTransaction.Auth) or etc.- i.e. you connect without an initialization transaction. In the latter case the INITIALIZING state is skipped and we go straight to being implicitly INITIALIZED.

      • PERFORMING_OTA

        public static final BleDeviceState PERFORMING_OTA
        This state for "over-the-air" updates becomes active when you call BleDevice.performOta(BleTransaction.Ota) and remains active until the provided BleTransaction calls BleTransaction.succeed() or BleTransaction.fail() (or of course if your BleDevice becomes DISCONNECTED).

    • Field Detail

      • FULL_MASK

        public static final int FULL_MASK
        Full bitwise mask made by ORing all BleDeviceState instances together.

      • VALUES

        public static BleDeviceState[] VALUES()
        Returns same as values(), but for performance reasons this does not return a new array every time.

      • getTransitoryConnectionState

        public static BleDeviceState getTransitoryConnectionState(int stateMask)
        A convenience for UI purposes, this returns the "highest" connection state representing a transition from one state to another, so something with "ING" in the name (except PERFORMING_OTA). Chronologically this method returns CONNECTING, DISCOVERING_SERVICES, AUTHENTICATING (if BleDevice.connect(BleTransaction.Auth) or BleDevice.connect(BleTransaction.Auth, BleTransaction.Init) is called), BONDING (if relevant), and INITIALIZING (if BleDevice.connect(BleTransaction.Init) or BleDevice.connect(BleTransaction.Auth, BleTransaction.Init) is called).
        Parameters:
        stateMask - Generally the value returned by BleDevice.getStateMask().

      • isNull

        public boolean isNull()
        Description copied from interface: State
        Returns true if this state is meant to stand in for Java's built-in null.
        Specified by:
